TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants bought a flat in a block of flats under construction from PERSON , a private company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sued PERSON claiming that the flat had a number of construction defects . They requested repairs to be done and claimed damages .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) dismissed their claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the applicant ’s appeal , set the judgment aside and remitted the case for fresh examination .

CARDINAL . At the hearing of CARDINAL DATE the applicants further specified their claims , following which the court adjourned the hearing to enable the respondent to familiarise itself with the changes .
CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place as CARDINAL of the applicants failed to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the respondent motioned for involvement of CARDINAL co - respondents which included CARDINAL private companies and a municipal agency .
CARDINAL . NORP The hearing of DATE did not take place due to the judge ’s illness .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court granted the above motion and the applicant ’s motion for filing of some additional documents and adjourned the hearing .
CARDINAL . The applicants again specified their claims on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings were adjourned to enable CARDINAL of the co - respondents to study the case file .

CARDINAL . The hearing of CARDINAL DATE was adjourned at the request of CARDINAL of the respondents in order to enable it to draw up an act for elimination of the defects in the applicants’ flat . The applicants did not object .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court scheduled a construction expert examination . The proceedings were resumed on DATE when the court again adjourned the hearing following additional specification of the ORG claims .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the claims in part , following which the parties appealed . On DATE the appeal court sent the case back to the first instance for consideration of the applicants’ objections to TIME . On DATE the hearing at the appeal court did not take place following lack of due notification and the resulting default in appearance of the respondents . On DATE ORG overturned the judgment of DATE and ordered new examination at the trial court .
CARDINAL . The hearing of CARDINAL DATE did not take place due to the respondents’ default in appearance .
CARDINAL . The hearings scheduled for DATE , DATE and DATE did not take place as the applicants and CARDINAL of the respondents failed to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided that the defaulting parties had been duly summoned and left the claims without consideration .
CARDINAL . Neither of the parties provided a copy of the above decision or the hearing minutes recorded DATE and DATE .
